bgeo

Class Circle

  • java.lang.Object
    • bgeo.Circle

  • public class Circle
extends Object
    A class to handle basic 2D geometry operations related to circles. These operations include division in equal parts, distances and squared distances to points, lines and circles and the the calculation of intersection points between circles and lines and circles.
    Author:
    ale

        Calculates the position of the closest point in the circle to a specified point

        py - y-coordinate of the point.

      • intersect

        public ArrayList<PVector> intersect(float x,
                           float y,
                           float r)
        Parameters:
        x - x-coordinate of the other circle.
        y - y-coordinate of the other circle.
        r - radius of the other circle.
        Returns:
        If circles intersect a PVector[] with the intersection points. Null otherwise.

      • checkIntersection

        public static boolean checkIntersection(float ax,
                        float ay,
                        float ar,
                        float bx,
                        float by,
                        float br)
        Checks the intersection between two circles without calculating the intersection points.
        Parameters:
        ax - x-coordinate of the center of the first circle.
        ay - y-coordinate of the center of the first circle.
        ar - Radius of the first circle.
        bx - x-coordinate of the center of the second circle.
        by - y-coordinate of the center of the second circle.
        br - Radius of the second circle.
        Returns:
        true if both circles intersect, false otherwise.

      • intersect

        public static ArrayList<PVector> intersect(float ax,
                           float ay,
                           float ar,
                           float bx,
                           float by,
                           float br)
        Calculates the intersection points between two circles.
        Parameters:
        ax - x-coordinate of the center of the first circle.
        ay - y-coordinate of the center of the first circle.
        ar - Radius of the first circle.
        bx - x-coordinate of the center of the second circle.
        by - y-coordinate of the center of the second circle.
        br - Radius of the second circle.
        Returns:
        An array with the intersections points. @{null} if there's no intersection.
